title: For, In, From, and Since | Grammar Exercise

exercises.title: For, In, From, and Since | Grammar Exercise

questions.question: I once studied the violin .......................... six months.
questions.description: Use for with periods of time.

questions.question: I have known him ........................... our school days.
questions.description: Since gives the starting point of an action or situation.

questions.question: That house has been empty ......................... several years.
questions.description: Use for with a period of time.

questions.question: How long have you been here ...........................?
questions.description: For shows duration. Use it with a period of time.

questions.question: He has not been keeping good health ........................... he moved to the city.
questions.description: Since gives the starting point of something.

questions.question: I am going to my native place ........................... the summer.
They are getting married ............................. July.
questions.description: Use in before the names of months and seasons.

questions.question: ................................ now on, I am going to go jogging every day.
questions.description: From gives the starting point of an action or situation. We mainly use it with simple tenses.

questions.question: The shop was open .......................... six in the morning.
questions.description: From is mainly used with simple tenses. Since is mainly used with perfect tenses.

questions.question: Trees shed their leaves ................................. autumn.
questions.description: Use in before the names of months and seasons.

questions.question: I have been working .................................. 10 o'clock and I am getting tired.
questions.description: We mainly use since with perfect and perfect continuous tenses.

questions.question: I have known her ......................... Monday.
questions.description: Use since with the starting point.
